name: Automate Bug Reports: GitHub Issues ‚Üí AI Analysis ‚Üí Jira Tickets with Slack & Discord Alerts

parameters.content:
## üîÑ AUTOMATED BUG WORKFLOW

### Flow: Webhook ‚Üí Filter ‚Üí Extract ‚Üí AI ‚Üí Parse ‚Üí Jira ‚Üí Notify ‚Üí Respond

### Benefits
‚úÖ Instant AI triage
‚úÖ Auto-assignment
‚úÖ Zero manual work
‚úÖ Saves 15-20 min/bug
‚úÖ $685/month ROI

### Setup Requirements
- GitHub repo access
- OpenAI API key (GPT-4o)
- Jira credentials
- Slack workspace (optional)
- Discord server (optional)

## üì• STEP 1: WEBHOOK

**Setup:**
1. Activate workflow
2. Copy webhook URL from this node
3. GitHub ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Webhooks ‚Üí Add webhook
4. Paste URL
5. Content-type: application/json
6. Events: Select "Issues"
7. Save

**Test:** Create a new issue in GitHub

## üîç STEP 2: FILTER

**Purpose:** Only process NEW issues

**Checks:** action = "opened"
- TRUE: Continue
- FALSE: Stop

**Why:** Prevents duplicate Jira tickets from issue edits, labels, or comments

## üìã STEP 3: EXTRACT DATA

**Extracts:**
- Issue number & title
- Description & reporter
- Labels & URL
- Repository info
- Mentioned files (regex)

**File Detection:**
Finds: .js, .py, .ts, .jsx, .tsx, .java, .go, .rb, .php, .cpp, .c, .css, .html

## ü§ñ STEP 4: AI ANALYSIS

**GPT-4o analyzes:**
- Bug severity (Critical/High/Medium/Low)
- Category (Backend/Frontend/DB/API/UI/etc)
- Reproduction steps
- Potential root cause
- Priority (P0-P3)
- Complexity & time estimate
- Recommended developer

**Setup:** Add OpenAI credentials

**Cost:** ~$0.01-0.03 per issue

## üîß STEP 5: PARSE & MAP

**Functions:**
- Parse AI JSON response (with error handling)
- Map developer types to emails
- Convert priorities (P0‚ÜíHighest)
- Prepare Jira labels array

**‚ö†Ô∏è CUSTOMIZE THIS:**
Update email addresses in the code:
```
"backend-dev": "backend@company.com"
"frontend-dev": "frontend@company.com"
"fullstack-dev": "fullstack@company.com"
"devops": "devops@company.com"
```

## üé´ STEP 6: CREATE JIRA

**Setup:**
1. Add Jira Software Cloud credentials
2. Update YOUR_JIRA_PROJECT_KEY
3. Replace your-company.atlassian.net URLs

**Ticket includes:**
- GitHub issue link
- Original description
- Complete AI analysis
- Auto-assigned developer
- Priority & labels set

**Get API Token:**
Jira ‚Üí Profile ‚Üí Security ‚Üí API Tokens ‚Üí Create

## üîî STEP 7: NOTIFICATIONS

**3 Parallel Branches:**

1Ô∏è‚É£ **GitHub Comment**
- Posts on original issue
- Links to Jira ticket
- Shows AI analysis summary

2Ô∏è‚É£ **Slack Alert**
- Rich formatted message
- All bug details
- Action buttons

3Ô∏è‚É£ **Discord Alert**
- Markdown formatted
- Links to both platforms

All execute simultaneously!

## ‚úÖ STEP 8: RESPOND

**Returns JSON to GitHub:**
```
{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Bug processed",
  "jiraTicket": "ENG-123"
}
```

**Why important:**
- Confirms processing succeeded
- Prevents GitHub retries
- Shows success in webhook log

**Monitor:**
GitHub ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Webhooks ‚Üí Recent Deliveries

# üîß TROUBLESHOOTING

**Webhook not triggering?**
‚úÖ Activate workflow first
‚úÖ Check webhook URL copied correctly
‚úÖ Verify "Issues" event selected in GitHub
‚úÖ Test with curl or create test issue

**AI analysis fails?**
‚úÖ Add OpenAI credentials in n8n
‚úÖ Verify API key is valid
‚úÖ Check GPT-4o access on account
‚úÖ Review OpenAI API status

**Jira ticket creation fails?**
‚úÖ Add Jira credentials (email + API token)
‚úÖ Update YOUR_JIRA_PROJECT_KEY
‚úÖ Verify "Bug" issue type exists
‚úÖ Check assignee emails are valid

**Slack notification fails?**
‚úÖ Re-authenticate Slack OAuth
‚úÖ Verify channel name (use "dev-alerts" not "#dev-alerts")
‚úÖ Check bot has permission to post
‚úÖ Invite bot to private channels

**Discord notification fails?**
‚úÖ Verify webhook URL is complete
‚úÖ Test webhook with curl
‚úÖ Check webhook not deleted in Discord

**GitHub comment fails?**
‚úÖ Use GitHub OAuth2 authentication
‚úÖ Verify repo permissions
‚úÖ Check owner/repo names are correct

# üìä ROI CALCULATOR

**Manual Process per Bug:**
- Read & assess: 5 min
- Determine category: 2 min
- Create Jira ticket: 5 min
- Assign developer: 2 min
- Notify team: 2 min
- Update GitHub: 1 min
**Total: 17 minutes**

**Automated Process:**
**6-8 seconds** ‚ö°

**Monthly Savings (50 bugs):**
- Time saved: 825 min (13.75 hrs)
- Labor value: $687.50 (@$50/hr)
- OpenAI cost: ~$2
- **Net savings: $685/month**

**Annual ROI:**
**$8,220 saved per year** üí∞

**Additional Benefits:**
‚úÖ Consistent quality
‚úÖ Zero human error
‚úÖ 24/7 availability
‚úÖ Instant response
‚úÖ Better developer morale

# üé® CUSTOMIZATION IDEAS

**1. Add more developer types:**
Edit Parse GPT Response node:
```javascript
const developerMapping = {
  "backend-dev": "backend@company.com",
  "frontend-dev": "frontend@company.com",
  "mobile-dev": "mobile@company.com",
  "qa-engineer": "qa@company.com",
  "devops": "devops@company.com"
};
```

**2. Filter by severity:**
Add IF node after Parse:
- Only process Critical/High bugs
- Route low-priority to separate flow

**3. Route by channel based on severity:**
```javascript
const channel = severity === 'Critical' 
  ? 'critical-alerts' 
  : 'dev-alerts';
```

**4. Add email notifications:**
Insert Send Email node after Jira
- Email assigned developer
- Include all bug details

**5. Custom Jira labels:**
```javascript
jiraLabels: [
  category,
  severity,
  'auto-triaged',
  `repo-${repositoryName}`
]
```

**6. Multi-repository support:**
Add Switch node after Filter:
- Route different repos to different Jira projects
- Assign to different teams
- Use custom AI prompts per repo

meta.name: GitHub to Jira Bug Sync with GPT-4o Analysis & Team Alerts
